title: Stakeholder Management & Networking
description: Vocabulary for stakeholder engagement and relative clauses for providing detailed information.

items.explanation: A stakeholder is anyone affected by or interested in a project.
items.prompt: What is the general term for any individual or group affected by a project's outcome?

items.explanation: Defining relative clause: 'who' or 'that' for people.
items.prompt: The manager ________ (who / that) is responsible for stakeholder engagement is out of the office today.

items.explanation: Stakeholders with high power and high interest should be managed closely.
items.prompt: According to stakeholder mapping, how should you handle 'High Power, High Interest' individuals?

items.explanation: Non-defining relative clause: needs commas and 'which' for things.
items.prompt: The stakeholder map, ________ (which) I updated this morning, is available on the shared drive.

items.explanation: To follow up means to take further action after an initial contact.
items.prompt: Which phrase describes contacting someone again after a networking event to maintain the relationship?
The investor ________ (whose) interest we are monitoring has requested a meeting.

items.explanation: Transparency involves sharing information openly to build trust.
items.prompt: Which concept refers to the practice of sharing project information openly with stakeholders?

items.explanation: To leverage means to use to maximum advantage.
items.prompt: We should ________ our professional network to find a suitable candidate for the role.

items.explanation: 'Whom' is the formal objective form (the object of 'with').
items.prompt: The client with ________ I was speaking is interested in our new proposal. (Formal)

items.explanation: An elevator pitch is a short summary.
items.prompt: Prepare a 30-second ________ ________ to introduce yourself at the networking lunch.
